posts._title: Edgar Reitz & Ula Stöckl – Geschichten vom Kübelkind AKA Tales Of The Dumpster Kid (1971)
posts.title: Geschichten vom Kübelkind
posts.excerpt: A woman screams, a newborn baby cries. A nurse leaves the hospital and dumps a bucketfull of slimy afterbirth into a bin.Moments later, Kubelkind (“Dumpster-kid”, an Austrian insult) emerges fully grown from the slime. “Frau Dr. Welfare”, a cold, upper middle-class do-gooder discovers Kubelkind in the dustbin and plans to “save” her. posts.title: Escargot de Vénus
posts.excerpt: Borowczyk’s portrait of the painter Bona Tibertelli de Pisis and her erotic fusions of men, women and molluscs.

posts._title: Luc de Heusch – Gestes du repas (1958)
posts.title: Gestes du repas
posts.excerpt: Luc De Heusch – Les gestes du repas (1958)1958. 35 mm., black and white, 23′. Les Gestes du repas (Mealtime Gestures),This ethnographic film shows us the image of man at his table. An acute view of Belgium.

posts._title: Marcelo Piñeyro – Cenizas del paraíso aka Ashes from Paradise (1997)
posts.title: Cenizas del paraíso
posts.excerpt: Ashes of Paradise (Spanish: Cenizas del Paraíso) is a 1997 Argentine film from director Marcelo Piñeyro. It tells in cutbacks how the untroubled private happiness of a family – a judge and his three grown-up sons – crumbles between loyalty and betrayal, blind trust and suspicions. The film won several awards, among them a renowned …

posts.title: Log 0
posts.excerpt: Clipping, noise, and other distortions are encounters with the threshold of photographic realism. the inner-workings of the systems we employ to generate adequate representations of the world become represented themselves in their failure – Isaac Goes

posts.title: Goshogaoka
posts.excerpt: arsenal-berlin.de wrote:Filmed in a middle school gymnasium in suburban Japan, GOSHOGAOKA takes as its ostensible subject the exercise routines and drills of a girls baskettball team.
